com.srch2.android.http.service

Class DeleteResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.srch2.android.http.service.DeleteResponse

  • public final class DeleteResponse
extends Object
    Wraps the RESTful response from the SRCH2 search server upon completion of a deletion task.

    When either the method call mIndexable.delete(String primaryKeyOfRecordToDelete) or the corresponding call SRCH2Engine.deleteFromIndex(String indexName, String primaryKeyOfRecordToDelete) is made, the SRCH2Engine will forward the delete request to the SRCH2 search server; after the SRCH2 search server finishes executing, it will notify the SRCH2Engine of the status of the completed deletion task. The SRCH2Engine will pass this information through the StateResponseListener callback method onDeleteRequestComplete(String indexName, DeleteResponse response) where the DeleteResponse response is this object.

    If the primary key submitted matches that of an existing record, the deletion task will be successful and getSuccessCount() will return one. If no record is found for the submitted primary key, getSuccessCount() will return zero and getFailureCount() will return one.

    In the event of a failure to delete a record, inspecting the value of getRESTfulResponseLiteral() will contain the reason for the failure.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int FAILED_TO_CONNECT_RESPONSE_CODE
      Indicates the SRCH2 search server was unavailable to process a request.
      static int INVALID_COUNT
      Indicates the InfoResponse was unable to be formed from the JSON response from the SRCH2 server upon performing an info command.
      static String IRRECOVERABLE_NETWORK_ERROR_MESSAGE
      Indicates the SRCH2 search server was unavailable to process a request.

        public static final String IRRECOVERABLE_NETWORK_ERROR_MESSAGE
        Indicates the SRCH2 search server was unavailable to process a request.

    • Method Detail

      • getSuccessCount

        public int getSuccessCount()
        Utility method for determining if the primary key submitted in the deletion task matched an existing record that was subsequently and successfully deleted.
        Returns:
        the number of successful deletions

      • getFailureCount

        public int getFailureCount()
        Utility method for determining if the deletion task failed such as no record was found with the submitted primary key.
        Returns:
        the number of failed deletions

        public String toToastString()
        Convenience method for outputting to toasts.
        Returns:
        a human readable description of this object that nicely fits into a toast

      • getRESTfulHTTPStatusCode

        public final int getRESTfulHTTPStatusCode()
        For each task executed by the SRCH2 search server, the server will return a HTTP status code of the completed request. Calling this method returns this status code.
        Returns:
        the HTTP status code as returned by the SRCH2 search server

      • getRESTfulResponseLiteral

        public final String getRESTfulResponseLiteral()
        For each task executed by the SRCH2 search server, the server will return a RESTful response in for the form a JSONObject. Calling this method will return the literal of this JSONObject.

        This method may return the value of IRRECOVERABLE_NETWORK_ERROR_MESSAGE if the SRCH2 search server was unavailable.
        Returns:
        the RESTful response literal as returned by the SRCH2 search server
